article.headline: Army 59, Sacred Heart 58
article.story: WEST POINT, N.Y. (AP) -- Jarell Brown hit a three-pointer with two seconds to play and Army beat Sacret Heart 59-58 on Sunday. Brown, who scored 24 points, shot 10-for-18 from the floor including four 3-pointers for the Black Knights (10-4). Matt Bell had 15 points and Marcus Nelson grabbed 12 rebounds. The Pioneers led 31-28 after the first half, and Jarrid Frye made a pair of baskets to open the second half for Sacred Heart (6-7). Frye finished with 14 points. Luke Granato had 13 points and Joey Henley scored 12 for the Pioneers. Army rallied with a 28-9 run and was leading 55-47 with 3:33 to play. But a pair of Luke Granato three-pointers fueled a 10-point burst and Sacred Heart went ahead 57-55. Army's Chris Walker split a pair of free throws with 15 seconds left, and Granato did the same four seconds later, setting the stage for Brown's final shot.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
